name: higi
title: An App I will delete
text: Mostly worthless. Although you can track past readings, the most important feature - scanning a QR code at a machine that has no Internet - does not work at all.

name: higi
title: New update offers spam over metrics
text: Used to be a four, maybe five, star app where you could check into one of their stations to check your blood pressure and weight then open app to track how you're doing over time (known as metrics on app). Had a monthly challenge and a website where you could get a small coupon or donate your 'watts' (basically points earned for 'steps' you've done)to one of two charities. Simple and easy!! NOW, I wouldn't recommend this app to my worst enemy!! Omg, mostly 'spam' when opens up as it goes on about the new communities they want to expand on, talks about the two they have, asks trivia, asks how you doing, blah, blah, blah. The challenge is still there, only they now also do extra ones for each community so who knows if anyone is actually in the community for what the community is there for or just for the chance at a gift card. This makes these communities almost worthless to connect to others in the same situation as you, which may be why you joined. The metrics are now last, and they will even ask 'what do you use the app for' if you email them about this horrible update!! Even if this is free, just NO! My recommendation is keep eye out for the stations & use them plus a small notebook to keep track of your own blood pressure & weight. If you can't find one then, and only then, download app to find a station. Just be aware that it's up to you to notice if the station is working correctly on top of everything else. You have been warned!

name: higi
title: Pretty good, but...
text:
I'd like to make a few suggestions for updates to make this app a 5 star app in my opinion. 

Firstly, I'm a sucker for achievements. I love that you can collect them through Higi, but its a shame that you cannot view them anywhere within the app. 

Secondly, I'm asked to re-log in way too much when I open the app multiple times a day. Not a deal breaker of course, just annoying. 

Thirdly, I track my weight using a Fitbit Aria scale,  but I also like to run the full gamut of tests at a higi station. (The Fitbit scale does not count BMI Like the station) I would like a way to select which weight data to go off of so I don't have to view differing weights on the same day. 

All that being said, the app is quite nice, I enjoy the challenges and the info it provides.

name: higi
title: Thanks for constantly reminding me I'm "obese"
text:
Seriously higi, could you please use a little more compassion when labeling thing on both your app and at the stations. 
When I check in and the results tell me I'm "obese" and then I use the app and the weight chart on the right hand side says "obese" as you look at your progress. 
I'm trying to better myself and labeling the chart in that manner makes it difficult to continue feeling motivated. 
Maybe change it to something more positive to help inspire instead of reminding them of how the populace views them.
Please don't force a label on someone when they are trying to improve.

name: higi
title: Doesn't stay connected to Fitbit
text: I've been using this app for about a month now. I love that it notifies me when I'm close to a Higi station and it keeps track of my results. However, it seems to have an issue losing connection to my FitBit Flex. I have to go in and reselect FitBit, login and it immediately loses the connection again. I want to be able to compete in some of the challenges, but it's not getting all of my activity that is being tracked in my FitBit. Please fix that and I'll improve my rating!

title: Doesn't work

name: higi
title: Add apple products
text: Please add Apple Watch and health app to supported connections so data is more connected in one place.

name: higi
title: Opportunities for improvement
text:
Kudos to the Higi team for building a great platform and an accessible network of stations. The insights from the higi station have helped me understand my body better and improve my lifestyle all along my 45Lb weight loss journey. As a daily user, I wish a few things were different about my experience: 

1. I do not feel comfortable entering my login information in a public place. I could previously scan a QR code and only had to log in on my phone. 

2. I do not feel comfortable entering my date of birth in public. Is Age not a sufficient input? 

3. I wish the phone app would atleast remember my user name if security is a concern. Frankly security isn't a concern for me since my phone needs a pass code. Almost everybody used a pass code these days! I wish it atleast had an option to "remember my password".

4. I wish the Higi app would share data with the IOS health app. It's a widely compatible health tracking platform that has become wildly popular for the same reason. My fitbit app works that way. This makes it so much more convenient to see all my data in one place. Will it reduce my time spent on the Higi app? Yes it will. If the intention is to build a future channel to monetize on ads, I don't really read the articles on the app since they aren't really focused on my goals- maybe another improvement opportunity. 

After thrashing the hard workers on the Higi team with my last comment, here's some food for thought to lighten up the mood- what if Higi worked with insurance companies to collect lab test results and bring it to my phone's health app? Now, that's something insurance companies would pay for. A lot of insurance plans offer free Fitbits to keep people health and thus reduce their risks. I feel Higi can step into the league if they make their case well.

My health achievements are one of many out there, ready to be cited. 

Keep up the great job, don't disappoint. Your users are watching you!

1) stop making me log in every time I open it. Convenience factor is huge. 

2) APPLE WATCH CONNECTION?! Why not have the biggest name of devices be listed to connect? I bought it specifically for tracking and I love it. Also have it connect with apple's health app!

text:
The app is great for viewing my historical trends of weight and blood pressure. I like that it grabs my account information from the Higi stations. However, for an iPhone app, I hate that it doesnâ€™t store my log-in information. When I stop to do a health check, when Iâ€™m done I hop back in my car and I check my iPhone to see the trend. Every single time I have to type out my long email address and password before gaining access to my stats. My only other recommendation would be to add the ability to email my statistics to my doctor. 

Like I said, itâ€™s a good app, but it could use some more work.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Horrible UX
text:
Wanted to use this app badly but thoroughly disappointed. 
- The UI design is horrible; for a consumer app, Aetna being one of the big insurance companies with millions of customers should have invested more in UI/UX design.Irregular font sizes, boring color themes make this app very unwelcoming to use
- Performance is pretty bad. Looks like the developers stuffed a web app with a native container. Takes forever to load.
- Touch ID doesn’t work consistently. I understand security is very important in regulated industry but when my local community bank has an awesome app that is secure, I don’t see why a big insurance company can have one that works.
- Search is slow!
- The ID card aspect ratio is not correctly calculated. Even their own logo is stretched in some cases. Not sure if someone from marketing approved this.

Overall, a bad app. It amazes me how big companies try to cut corners in consumer facing apps. What’s the point of publishing an app that was built at low cost that no one wants to use.

title: Terrible App
text: This is hands down the worst app on my phone and it certainly is up there (if not at the top of the heap) in terms of being the worst app ever to grace any of my various iPhones. Let me just mention one area of its awfulness: why must I type in my password when I have set the app to open on Touch ID? I open the app, it asked me to log in via Touch ID and then it asks me to type in my password. What the %*^%^*?

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Just go online
text:
Somehow it can’t seem to ever authenticate my fingerprint, nor does it store my user name. So, even though every other app that uses my fingerprint works just fine (the issue is not my phone), when I go into this app, I have to type out my full username and password every time. If I go online at least my web browser will remember my username and password. 

Another issue...I requested a refill on a prescription. It took my credit card number and seemed to work just fine, but then nothing actually processed. You don’t get any kind of email or notification that it went through. The order history says it takes 48 hours from the time your doctor sends in the prescription to update. So it took days before I realized that my prescription had not actually been processed. It would be nice if they had more timely order histories so you could see immediately that your request had gone through. That’s probably more a reflection of Aetna themselves rather than the ineffectiveness of this app.

The Doctor has no faxes from Aetna and no messages were left for the nurses regarding the required paperwork. They put all responsibility on the patient/client to obtain required documentation. 

They've called me on past claims and gotten upset for not reaching me and my not returning their call for 4-5 days. The 1st day they called I was in surgery and when they called two days later could not talk due to the type of surgery. 

They're the worst!

title: Terrible
text:
This app forces me to do a "mandatory update" every time I open it. I go to the App Store and it's already updated. It basically only lets me log in when I access it through the "open" button on its App Store listing. 

Also, it doesn't remember my user name, it doesn't have Touch ID, my plan information is not up to date, and it doesn't allow me to send or receive messages. It also loads incredibly slow.

Aetna's website and support is also awful, so this app is consistent with the low quality and bad service we can all expect from Aetna.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Can't get past the user agreement page
text:
This is quite disappointing. 

Agreeing to the User Agreement consistently gives me a network connection error. 

Very unusable.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Terrible!!
text: This app is awful! Does not work! I hate the darn thing.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Useless
text: This app tells me nothing at all.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Not good at all
text: I can't get any data. It loads. I can see my info one time. Then, constant error message. Can't see the data again. Same error others complain about. I'm also an iPhone user. Please fix this!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Horrible and annoying app!
text:
Takes ages to load anything, even with very good connectivity over wifi/ lte this app keeps saying no network connectivity!
Doesnt deserve any star as such....

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Unable to reset password using app
text: I'm trying to logon and it tells me that my password needs to be reset.  The spinner seems to go around non-stop and the password never get's updated.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: What a joke
text: The app works great once you download it, and sign in for the first time. The if you open it again, once you've signed in, with either pin or thumb scan, an you click the "manage leave/disability" button, you get a  "We're sorry, we can't complete your request. Please try again letter". This error will not go away unless you delete the app and reinstall it. Your online app is more dependable. This app is a waste of time

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Instant crashes on iPhone 6+
text:
On 3.0.0 when opening the app it crashes instantly on iPhone 6 +, 

UPDATE: Still crashes on 3.0.1

UPDATE: app allows me to login however the app now crashes while setting up the Touch ID settings

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Much better! Way easier to log in
text: The look and feel is much better. Happy to have the ID card in Apple wallet because I forget it all the time. Worked well for me but transplant review wins for most entertaining review.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: We Were All Gonna Die Eventually Anyway
text:
It's pretty haunting to download this app. That's right, the same people who built this clunky, bug-ridden, unusable app make health care decisions for millions of people every day. 

I could definitely foresee a scenario where I need an organ (let's be honest, it'll probably be a liver) and don't get it bc Aetna's organ delivery app crashes on the driver. Aetna should be ashamed of themselves for ever taking this app live.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Poorly designed
text: This app is poorly designed. Search results for local specialists keep showing me 1) urgent care facilities 2) specialists in states 2000 miles away. Also, the reviews posted on the app for doctors and specialists are partial reviews. To get the full reviews you have to hit the link for another doctor-rating website. Once you get to that site you have to search around for that doctor, which isn't always easy to search for -- why wouldn't it link you directly to the review?  I don't think this app was tested at all-- it's the app equivalent of Craigslist.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Nice work!
text: Much needed update. Don't need to carry plastic I'd card anymore!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Worthless
text: needed to find radiology near me and got list all over the country....nothing near me. For fun selected one and got a message "not in network". Useless.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Clean update...
text: App is modernized, and has improved login with Touch ID.  I like it.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Great App
text: Great App

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Needs a scroll
text: Overall decent but when viewing letters or images it's almost impossible to scroll he image. Additional options are needed for those items as well like; print- forward- mark up; etc...

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Giving credit where it's due
text: The new Aetna app (3.0) is a substantial improvement over the old app. It looks and feels like a 2017 app. Much more usable, touchID support, so far so good!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: App crash
text: The app doesn't open and when it does it crashes immediately. Can you please rectify the problem.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Sorry, Aetna
text: This app is pretty much worthless. The list of issues is lengthy, and not worth my time to list and explain here. Best advice to users...don't bother. Best advice to Aetna...don't try to fix it. Trash it, hire a decent developer and start over.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Dysfunctional
text: Ever sine the update, I am completely unable to sign in.  It was ok and functional before the update.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Doesn't work.
text: Was forced to download new release. At 9.3.5 of iPhone. Starts to load and goes away.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Nice app!
text: Nice to use

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Horrible
text: Clunky, slow, crashes every time you try to locate a provider. Why do I even bother

name: Aetna Mobile
title: searching for a doc?
text: Don't bother because this app will not help you. Trying to find a doctor in my area that accepts new patients. The only things I can find are hospitals or chiropractors. Trying to find a gynecologist? Good luck. Better search by pregnancy... not all who need a gynecologist are pregnant. Was this made by a man? Less options does not mean easier or better.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Useless
text: The app is more annoying than ever! It has well designed links to useful information about your health insurance policy. When you click on one, the circle thing will spin forever until you close the app, restart it, and try again. If you don't see the circles, the other new feature is a pleasant error message blaming you for a bad network connection even though you know for sure that your network connection is fine. Don't bother logging on to the website. It doesn't work either. Hopefully the customer service people are nice on the phone because that's the only way you can get any info.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Not enough info
text: This app lacks information of coverage that the website has. For example, online tells me which provider has maximum or standard savings, while app simply states if a doc is covered or not. I still need the website and will delete the app.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Always errors out. Do not update.
text: I updated to this version in hopes to gain a better experience, but every time i log in i get a "999" error that "something went wrong". Deleting and redownloading did not help. Contacting customer support did not help as they said "try again later". Please release a functioning app. This app does not give me confidence is the ole "private companies can provide better solutions then government ones" mantra.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Better but still not good
text:
The new revision to the app is an improvement for signing on. While other apps are using a Pin or your thumbprint, Aetna has been far behind and has finally caught up. 

After that, I find the new configuration difficult to understand much less find a provider. The previous version was much better for that. So for now I will use another program to locate providers and keep checking back on this one. Such a shame.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Crashes on start
text: iOS 9.3.3 iPhone 6s... Please fix

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Doesn't work at all on iPhone 6!
text: Awful!!! Does not work at all on an iPhone 6. When you try and open the app it crashes immediately.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Crashes on Open, 6 Plus
text: Cannot even get past the sign-in page. Better to just use the website than bother with this app!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Search function
text: So difficult to search for a physician. Why is primary care coming up with nephrologists??? That's not right

name: Aetna Mobile
title: 0 stars
text: Awful. Can't read content of latest message in inbox. Medical claim explanations are useless.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: No iPad TouchID support
text: Why is TouchID only supported on iPhones, and not iPads?

name: Aetna Mobile
title: QA anyone?
text: Still wants credentials after setting up TouchID and this is after it promoted to use TouchID to access. Rather use website at this point.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: ID card available on one phone, but not the other
text: Still not working properly, even after update of July 14.  The Aetna ID card cannot be saved to the Apple Wallet using an iPhone 6 Plus, but it can be saved on our iPhone 7.  On the iPhone 6 Plus it gives a "network error" message when I try to pull up the ID card.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: very Good update
text: it is a good update, works well. different design. looks nice.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Aweful App experience
text: The old app was the worst app I interact, but the new version may be even worse.  Says I have no coverage; can't view my insurance card, my coverage and benefits, or anything else without getting a network error.  Amazing how terrible this app experience is and is unacceptable.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Needs a lot of improvement
text: I have the app on my phone and iPad. It does not adjust and size like it says it will. It usually starts with saying no information available and then it let you login and like it says it has no information available. I am new to Atnah and I thought it would be like logging into the Aetna navigator. Why isn't there a navigator app? When I logged in for support they can get anyway to talk to the app. Please fix it.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Awful Update
text: Completely useless now. Claims information is gone and coverage section returns an error. ID card is now just the Aetna prescription drug discount card. I sent an email in the feedback section and in typical Aetna fashion have not heard back. (Even deleted the app, shut down and restarted my phone, and then reloaded the app -- still useless!)

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Great Update
text: Awesome new look. Works well and performance is great. Thanks for the update. Keep 'em coming!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Awesome new app!
text: Easy setup. TouchId is nice. Breeze to navigate.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Nice updates
text: I'm happy Aetna went to a faster fingerprint log-in and mobile wallet functionality. Really nice enhancements.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Especially like having my card in my digital wallet
text: Thanks!!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: New design rocks
text: Love the new layout. Easy to navigate to what's important for me. Light years from the old design and much easier to use with Touch ID vs passwords that I always forgot.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Great Update!
text: Awesome UI/UX, simple and easy to navigate!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Amazing Update!
text: This app finally gets a makeover and its well worth the wait. I had a smooth login, was able to add the card to the Wallet and find providers.  Very Intuitive and modern design. Good going Aetna.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Great App!
text: Awesome

name: Aetna Mobile

name: Aetna Mobile

name: Aetna Mobile

text:
This new version is really much better 
Great work

name: Aetna Mobile

name: Aetna Mobile

text:
I really appreciate Aetna for the new improvements in the app. Touch ID, wallet, offline ID cards, these are some of the much needed features. I hope Aetna will add some fitness & virtual doctor type feature in this.
Keep doing the good work!!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Not impressed
text: Always get an "error message" every time I try to log in (not incorrect password or username). So now I have to call the company which completely defeats the purpose of the app

name: Aetna Mobile
title: I like where this is going...
text:
Super happy so far with the update. It makes the whole app feel cleaner/more organized and straightforward to navigate. 

I enabled Touch ID and have had no issues with that so far! 

I am also happy that I will now be able to see my 'health history' finally. 

In the future it would be great to add the ability to refill perceptions! Also the app appears to be a little slow, or lagging. I am sure with time and updates this will be fixed!!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Horrible like the company itself
text: The app is horrible just like the company itself. Now won't even load. Can't wait till the end of the year to switch insurance company.

name: Aetna Mobile

text: All the old complaints from the last app version have been addressed. You can now login with Apple ID, you can see you clams, and out of pocket max/deductible for the year. Also the app in general is much faster and more user friendly.

name: Aetna Mobile

text: User friendly app that is easy to navigate.  Useful features that are helpful to a member.  Great design and functionality.  Love it a lot.

This time, there was a false promise of easy login with Touch ID. Works the first time, and not thereafter. Did anyone happen to test that? Also, false promise of keeping card in Apple Wallet. But no, just a subset of the card info, not the whole card. Clearly the app was designed and updated by people who are not very comfortable with digital technology.

name: Aetna Mobile

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Useless

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Worst App I've Ever Seen
text: Whoever (and I mean everyone involved up to the CEO) developed this app should be fired. It is the very worst App I've ever tried to use. Congratulations! Aetna wins the prize for the MOST incompetent app development in the history of apps. No, that's too polite. It's perhaps the worst app EVER!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: An embarrassment of an app
text:
This app is the most clumsy, useless, outdated app on my phone.

Why can't I just see if a doctor is on my plan, not a listing of every state plan and otherwise that they accept?

Why do I have to log in every time? Touch ID exists for this kind of thing. Or even password manager integration.

Why is there no way to add my health card to passbook?

This is barely scratching the surface of how awful this app is. Please fix it, and you'll have countless satisfied customers.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Add thumbprint security
text: Why do I have to remember my login for an app?? Use the built in iPhone security. App is rudimentary.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Worst app
text: Worst app when you search for a specific doctor by name you get other doctors that are not even close to what you want.  Should list if doctor has a website.  Not user friendly at all.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Couldn't be worse
text: This is my second review ever in the App store in years however I just had to put on the record what a complete failure this App is. One has to wonder if they are even trying. For such a large company it is unexcusable. Don't download it is useless and also so poorly designed I suspect it is also likely a security risk.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: App doesn't work at all
text: This app doesn't work at all. It gives a "network connection was lost" error constantly even though both my cellular and wifi connections are functional on every single other app.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Doesn't even work
text: This app won't even let me sign in with my login that I know works. It's even worse than the Aetna website, which is saying something with how glitchy that is. Please fix this. It is not user friendly at all!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: App needs an overhaul
text: The UI needs an overhaul and more functionality added.  Touch ID would be great.  If the app would fit correctly on the screen on a 7 plus that would be an improvement.  App is slow in general.  Some time and attention needs to be given to this app if Aetna wants it to be successful.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Terrible!
text: How can such a big reputable insurance company like you have such a terrible outdated app?  Get with the program and update your app. Inexcusable, your IT dept should be ashamed.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Good basic functionality
text:
Provides access to basic information, which is helpful.

Lack of TouchID is frustrating, it's more secure and simpler than password entry. Please add support for TouchID

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Slow and dated app
text: Every time you back page, it brings you back to the top of the page making it frustrating to use. The app is also very slow. The Provider search filter doesn't work.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Claims not shown
text: From the mobile app I cannot view my claims. I know there are at least 2 and my deductible reflects the claims that have been processed, and does match the full site for accuracy but the claims are not shown. Not past or present. Not very useful when I can't see where my accumulations came from

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Horrible

Can't get to my card info, can't get to aetna pharmacy, can't get to anything I could actually use AND for doing nothing it's hard to navigate!! Who did they PAY to make this? I could make something better in an hour!

name: Aetna Mobile

name: Aetna Mobile

Both are serious problems because Aetna in its infinite wisdom has decided not to mail ID Cards.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Why even bother?
text:
Every time I search for a dr or facility, I get a system error. The UI is poor and the design is awful. I hope that the performance of this app  is not the same way they handle my claims.

Embarrassing.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Needs work
text: The app gives some of the most basic info that a member would want but is well short of what Aetna is capable of. For example, I would really like to be able to view pharmacy claims and EOB's within the app.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Worst app ever.
text: New job, switched from Cigna to Aetna. I like Aetna's insurance better but this app is a joke. Seriously whoever made it needs to go back to the 90's and never come back.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Just a pile of crap
text:
Every complaint in every review is correct. The fact that they haven't added fingerprint support, says a lot...

This app isn't worth the time. Also, being that it's free, it's still way too expensive. Getting the hint here Aetna?

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Not customer friendly
text:
For a big health insurance money that has more money than god. You would think they would cut the excessive bonus that the execs get a little bit to actually update the app to be worthwhile. 

How long has iPhone had Touch ID? 

Design from the late 1990's and not very easy to use. 

Worthle$$ app.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: This App is next to Useless
text: Apps are supposed to help you get things done quicker and on the go. This app does exactly opposite. Every thing in this app is very slow and unresponsive. This app looks so old if you put it next to the contemporary apps by other insurance providers. I am feeling like changing to other insurance for better experience.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Decent start, needs some modern day updates
text:
Mobile app, is not horrible, but needs some updates
- Overall user experience needs work. Navigation system is very rudimentary 
- Performance, even over wifi, is very slow
- Lacks Touch ID (thumbprint) login capability
- Member Card access should integrate with Apple Wallet

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Terrible
text: Out of 300 apps on my phone, clearly the worst

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Useless
text: I downloaded in 15 & it was lame. Updated 3/17, still lame. No approved drug list for you and your Dr to decide which drug is approved for you. Loses its place regularly. If you carry your ID card you don't need this APP 'cause that's all it's good for (replacing your card, which you can photo and carry around). It's lousy.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Disgraceful for a company this big
text:
Lame web-page design that has to be connected to show anything. 
Login can't use biometrics. Login can't remember anything. 
Fails to get data constantly. 
All I want us a way to access my ID card data easily so I don't have to carry the card in my wallet. This app fails to deliver even that basic need reliably.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Why even have an app?
text: When it's this bad what's the point? Just so you can say you have one? You basically don't, it's bad...

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Doesn't work for all Aetna customers
text: Unfortunately this app doesn't recognize me as a legit Aetna customer. Guess it's website only for me.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Needs updating
text:
First of all, please add Touch ID to the app. I have to look up my username and password every time I log in. 

Second, half of the information I try to bring up gets covered by the static parts of the interface. It's very annoying. 

It's easier to go to the web to get information than to use the app. It shouldn't be that way.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Come on Aetna!! :(
text: All of the reviews are right. This app is so antiquated. Please get it together immediately or don't have one at all. Even I could do better at building this app. Shame! Shame!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Claims
text: The app doesn't even let users check the basics, such as claims.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Terrible app
text: My company is slowly switching to digital cards via the Aetna app. Unfortunately the Aetna app looks and works like an 8 year old developed the app. Please update the app to be appealing and functional.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: App on life support
text: Despite $65B in annual revenue Aetna has decided not to invest in mobile. Much like their website this app is behind the times. Not optimized for iPhone 6, 6s or 7 screen sizes, doesn't use Touch ID. Seems like this app exists so they can box check mobile.  It's a mobile world Aetna, embrace it, hire a mobile team and update monthly, build something native.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Embarrassing
text: This may have passed for for a mobile app 6 years ago, today it is just embarrassing that Aetna thinks this is something to even keep on the App Store. There may be useful info hidden among the poor design and numerous bugs, but the frustration isn't worth it.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Functional, but falls short!
text:
It's nice to have this app and be able to look up my ID card, check my deductible and co-insurance status, and see a claims summary.  

Falls short in that:
• I can't save my username or access via my fingerprint 
• I can't save my ID card to Passbook for easy reference
• I can't view an EOB & the detailed info on claims is severely lacking (no codes on why items aren't covered, etc)
• Doc find is incredibly glitchy, filters don't work, can't search provider by name, can't sort by distance, etc., etc., etc....
• I can't "View full site" from within the app

Cut your HUGE profit margin a hair and invest in an app refresh. Was great for its time, but hasn't been updated and isn't up to par with current technology.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Spectacularly bad
text: Though clearly not abandoned, Aetna clearly has this app on very limited life support. It looks bad, barely functions, and provides very poor performance. It has the most limited amount of functionality necessary to stay in the App Store, but this is clearly an app that Apple should remove for not being maintained properly. Use it if necessary but it will be horribly disappointing.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Totally useless App
text:
This app is so native and useless. I would say it has the minimal functionality of all the Apps from other Health Insurance providers. 

Totally disappointed.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Total junk!
text: Can't log in to the app... says that it doesn't recognize my policy ID or my SSN???? Please fix!!!!

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Garbage
text:
Buggy and difficult to navigate.
Very disappointing for something that would be valuable to have on a smart phone.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: App Works Fine
text: I don't know what everyone is complaining about, the app works just fine for me.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Terrible
text: One of the worst apps I've ever user. The search keeps brings me the same results despite changing the filters and have of the other user options don't even seem to be working.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Appears Functional
text: I was able to log in and view my Coverage Card.  It would be nice if the Card could be saved to Passbook, so it could be accessed quickly without having to log in.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Garbage
text: The reviews don't lie.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Half star would be more appropriate
text:
UI is very user-unfriendly and looks like it's from when internet was first invented.

name: Aetna Mobile
title: Critical Functionality (Still) Missing
text:
I recently returned to Aetna for a varierty of reasons; their app was not one of them.  But I re-downloaded it anyway.  It finally allows the user to copy/paste his or her password; for that alone, I'll bump my rating up one from my previous of 1 star.  However, I would really like to see TouchID functionality.  Anthem can do it; why can't Aetna?  Perhaps it could be available in the app settings, but in another bizzare and troubling first for an app, I don't see a "Settings" menu anywhere within the app.  I'm not a developer, but I'm kind of surprised that an app can even get App Store approval without a settings menu within the app itself (I realize I can go to "settings" within the general "Settings" app, but it's just a bare-bones menu that allows you to decide whether to allow the app to use data, and that's it).  In addition, load times for other menus are slower than they have any right to be.

This app continues to demonstrate that Aetna's indifference and contempt for its members by allowing such an underdeveloped app to represent it.  Use it if you absolutely must, but the native website on iOS may be a better alternative.

But every time I have tried to access that page, the system has mysteriously "failed", never acknowledging my attempts.  Then out of frustration, I have gone to providers I know are Aetna providers, only to be penalized by Aetna because I didn't access their preferred provider page and get pre-approval!!
And their billing is HORRENDOUS!
Buyer be ware!!  Double check every invoice!!!
By the way, if you write a review, copy it, because if the nickname you choose is taken, they tell you that .... AND ERASE YOUR ENTIRE REVIEW, FORCING YOU TO START ALL OVER!!!  I'm sure, hoping you'll give up.  Copy, and keep trying until you get it through!

When I clicked on my benefits information I was shown the date my benefits started and that's it. No other information. If you're looking for any information about benefits eligibility, copays, deductible status you won't find it. 

The doctor search functionality had potential however they must have hired a user experience expert from the 80s. The interface makes even that a complete waste of effort and time. And more crashes. 

There's basically no other redeeming functionality to the app. I deleted after about an hour of trying to make it work.

I'd be embarrassed to have this app represent my company and brand. 

I have to wonder if they have any care whatsoever of their member needs. That's a truly terrifying thought.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Almost there
text:
I love the app, it helps me see my appointments and keep track of things.

My only issue so far is that it doesnâ€™t specifically show me where to go for an appointment...

For example, I have an appointment at 6:30am at the Fontana location in Radiology to get scanned. I can see on the appointment page the location with regards to the hospitalâ€™s address, but the hospital is divided into 4 buildings, 1,2,3 and their overnight building. Plus the outlying speciality buildings. There happen to be 4 Radiology units here. So if I have an appointment in building 3 on the basement level in Radiology, but show up to the 3rd floor Radiology unit in building 2 it might make me very late. I have good mobility, imagine if someone with poor mobility faced the same issue.

My suggestion, add the specific building and maybe the floor needed for checking in to the â€œlocationâ€� portion of the appointment page.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Looking Good!
text: I have used this app since it was released into production. It has served me well and it continues offer new and more convenient features. They kind of sneak up on me. Lol. One reviewer reports that Touch ID doesnâ€™t work as expected. I saw the same issue but after deleting the app, manually signing on and turning Touch ID on, it stayed on. I was prompted once to lift and rest a finger. From that point, all my finger prints work as expected. Yes, all. I use many for easy positioning. App support is responsive. So, try this first. NOTE: The app had been updated BUT may not have synched correctly with my hardware after iOS 11.4.1 was installed. This is what I suspect.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: App about as good as southern cal Kaiser care
text: My biggest pet peeve about this stupid app (same goes for your website) is your pharmacy system. It could be so convenient, if it were accurate and worked. There have been numerous times when it says my prescriptions are available for refill (meaning it's not on the list that says it's too early for a refill and won't allow you to even try) that I've requested a refill, and not only has my physician authorized the refill and the pharmacy I'm to pick it up at notified me it was ready for pick up, and I've taken the bus (I can't drive due to medical condition) all the way to the pharmacy only to get there and find out "oh sorry it's too early to refill that prescription". I get it, with the prescription drug abuse epidemic you have to be careful and strict and I'm fine with following any and all rules regarding that. But you need to link your website and app with your pharmacy rules so that people aren't told via the app it's okay to request a refill and their doctor okay that refill and the pharmacy tells you come pick it up, then you waste your time because when you do, oops sorry too soon. That's so ridiculous. And honestly 3 days before a medication you take daily is due to run out is when patients can request a refill? 3 days? It takes 3 days or longer just to get your doctors approval most times and then another 2 for it to be filled. I've run out of medications I take daily too many times because of this "rule" and I say "rule" because you never know if the pharmacist who is working follows that rule or not. Some do, some will fill a three month prescription a month early or a one month prescription 10 days early. At least be consistent so patients aren't suddenly told of a rule that supposedly isn't new but in the 13 years I've had kaiser insurance has never been enforced until recently. When I ask if it's new, nope, always been the rule. Huh, then you've got a whole lot of staff who don't follow your rules and that's an issue. The "past visit" info is a joke (it literally tells you nothing other than the date of your past visit) and the "medical history" is also a joke since it tells you any chronic illnesses you have (great thanks didn't know that already) and what medications you take (and never updates so apparently I've been on antibiotics for years now). 99% of appts you'd make you have to call to make anyways so the appt part is mostly useless as well. So all in all if you want to know where a Kaiser facility is located or need to email your doctor (which is the only reason I gave a star, this feature is useful, as long as your doctor actually checks and responds which 2 of mine do amazingly, and one takes several months to hear back if I do, but not the apps fault) then this app might work for you. Otherwise it's just a huge waste of space.

title: A LONG way from even an average app
text:
As a QA lead, I recognize apps that are poorly designed and implemented; this app fits that description well. Some of the major problems: exiting the app via the home button does NOT log you out, securely closing the app; going down several layers (such as looking at test results) requires the user to go back-back-back-back to a page where one can access the menus to sign-out; on my iPad 12.9, I MUST use the app in portrait because thatâ€™s the way it was coded; this app is somehow split off from other functions that should be accessible. There are many other issues needing work.

Kaiser should get someone familiar with QA and UI design to update this app. It has not had a major update since November 2016.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Need Self Reporting Ability
text:
This is a good app.  I can get my lab results as soon as they become available. I can re-order my medications quickly and easily. 

What would really be nice is the ability to self report health data like weight, BP, blood sugar levels, cholesterol levels and so on.  Iâ€™m trying to lose weight so I periodically weigh myself. Instead of some other app why canâ€™t I keep that data here?  I go to the Stanford blood bank and they compute my cholesterol level and take my BP.  Why canâ€™t I keep that data here?

The data I enter could be tagged as â€œself reportedâ€� so a medical provider would know if the data was my measurement or if it was taken by a professional. 

Providing this capability could be a plus in a patientâ€™s health care.  Imagine an overweight patient with a blood sugar and cholesterol problem. Instead of only having data points from when they see a Kaiser professional (primary physician, physicianâ€™s assistant, nurse, dietician, etc) the health provider has as much data as possible.  This could help reveal trends in health related behavior and thus better allow the provider to tailor treatment. 

Mobile computing could take health care to another level but health care providers like Kaiser are only scratching the surface.  Hopefully someone at Kaiser will see these comments and will consider the enhancements I have suggested above.

text: Not sure what the fuss is over... I love this new version much more than the previous version. It's easy to navigate, and everything is at my fingertips which I love. I have a busy life like everyone else so that is an important factor. I can easily message my doctor or any other provider I've been referred to and easily refill prescriptions. It was mentioned in a previous post that the Rx refill doesn't alert you of when it is ready for pick up.... that would be a great feature to add. Overall, great job!!

After trying it a few times, I called Kaiser who told me it has known issues and don't use it!!  Why have an app that is unstable? name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Getting better and better
text:
I have used this app through several upgrades. It used to be a little challenging to navigate, but now it is very easy. In the past I wouldn't have recommended the app to my elderly mother because it would have just confused and frustrated her. Now I feel like I can recommend it to her and she can successfully use it.  

There are people saying that they are having problems with this version, but I am not seeing them.  I am still able to use touch ID. It just needed to be enabled in settings.  I'm not having any crashing problems. It is much easier to get through the prescription refill process.  It used to timeout when I was emailing my doctor, but it doesn't do that anymore.  I love that I now have the option to receive a text when my Rx is ready at the pharmacy. 

I love this app and the improvements. I'm looking forward to seeing what they will do next.

Scheduling appointments results in an error message and no appointment. Subsequent attempts have not yielded success. I hope these glitches can be addressed. text: While the app has glitches and doesn't give users access to everything that kp.org offers, I still find it pretty useful. I no longer carry my kaiser ID card because it's contained in the app. I can also make appointments, check lab results, exchange messages with my doctor, and order/track my prescriptions quickly thanks to the app.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Best Health App
text: The features and functionality of this app are great. Thanks for the recent improvements in the pharmacy module.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Great stuff!
text:
I was really apprehensive about getting this app at first because of how few stars it has, but I went for it anyway and am glad I did!

I have been with Kaiser for two years and probably use this app at least once a week for one these reasons:
-Member ID #
-See a list of medications I've taken in the past, what I am currently taking, the dosages, and dates.
-Refill prescriptions and have them sent to my home
-Set up appointments
-See test results as soon as they're available

Improvements I would like to see:
-Have an offline mode with stored info so that I can view it if I'm on the phone

This is one of the first reviews I've given just because I saw it had so few stars but it's been incredibly helpful for me and I know it will be for others. Overall a great app!

title: This app never works! I mean NEVER!
text: This app is absolutely useless! Every time I attempt to schedule an appointment I make it to the very end, to confirm my appointment, and it tells me that this feature is currently unavailable please try again later. Just tried it again, what can I say I'm a gluten for punishment, and my family info is currently unavailable, so now I can't even attempt to schedule an appointment! Incredibly frustrating!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: A nice tool but needs improvement
text:
The app cuts off your physicians/providers names in the appointment section.. and they also don't list your providers names with last name first.. this makes it problematic when you show up for an appointment with a new doctor and you can only see their first and middle name. "Hi I'm here to see Dr. Briana Esther....?" Not sure. 

Some of the education tools providers send aren't viewable through the app. So you get a notification to view something you can't view. Annoying.

It'd be nice to have work status reports available through the app and the online portal for reference or to print additional copies if your work needs them. 

Touch ID for sign on doesn't work well. It will auto populate your password for you but you still have to click sign in after.. makes it kind of worthless if using Touch ID doesn't log you in all the way and open the app.

It would be nice if it worked better with iCal and imported complete address and appointment information. Now when you try to export information into your calendar.. it just says appointment and the street address of the office.. not the whole address.. not the suite number.. etc. you still end up having to go back in to the app.. so why export at all then? It'd be nice if it said appointment and then in notes or something said the doctors name, building number, suite or waiting area for check in, etc. Kaiser is huge and difficult to navigate.. these tools really should be designed to make the patient experience easier.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Back to the Stone Age

Older version much better, easily accessible information, comprehensive app. This is the most frustrating app I've ever seen; looks like it was conceptualized by 2nd year college student. Please fix this abomination!!!!

Want to check messages from your doctor? Oh sorry, that feature is not currently available in the app, please log into the website. Seriously, get with the times and make this thing usable.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Not very useful
text: When I go to the Pharmacy Center section, the app lets me add prescription refills to my cart--but won't let me GO to the cart. Clicking on "Go to Cart" merely reloads the current page. If this isn't fixed soon, I'm uninstalling this mostly-useless app.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: needs serious improvement to functioning and UX
text: Nice to be able to access lab results and appts quickly but numbers provided in tests are meaningless if you don't provide the patient with the ability to know what the number means and what the test is for (I shouldn't have to go back and forth to webmd or google to do research on what a test is for and if the results are normal or not.   I also can never seem to send an email reply to my provider in the app and always get a "message unsent" black bar and clicking resent never helps.  To further the frustration, I can't open the unsendable email to at least copy what I wrote to try again later - or more accurately log into the web app and retype and send it there. Very frustrating app.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Satisfies my needs
text:
This app is great for these things:

-I refill my prescriptions very easily

-I access my labs results as soon as they're available

-I review my after visit summaries whenever I want to

kp.org works well for these and is better for scheduling routine appointments. 

But if you need to be seen quickly, you do need to call, and there's a good reason why. Getting seen by a physician is more complicated than making an OpenTable reservation.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Rx refills require phone call
text: If a Rx is listed in patient history but not on the pre approved refill list, it's no longer possible to request a refill via mobile app; you're forced to call the pharmacy directly. Previously, the app would send an authorization request to the MD if re-authorization was necessary and the Rx would be processed (if approved) without inconveniencing the patient. I don't want to spend time on the phone waiting for a human who's working the counter to request the MD be contacted when the automated process was more conveniently and efficiently performing the same function. I'm now going to email my MD directly to save myself the hassle; and the MD or his staff have to deal with my email rather than caring for patients in the office. This is a huge problem. Kaiser: you blew this one!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Dated, slow app (even on iP7!)
text:
Slow app to access and find data, even on iP7 with a 100Mbps internet connection on 802.11ac. KP needs to upgrade their back-end.

Apple Pay for prescriptions, or check-in for appointments? Nope. 

Check-in for appointments on your iPhone? Nope.

Apple Watch? Nope. --They did have a walking app at one point but canned it. KP has a tendency to do things like that, and it's really silly.

No interface with Apple Health whatsoever on the iPhone. None. Period.

It would be nice to have all your lab work and test results pile into Health so you can see all detailed on your phone.

Please upgrade this thing! Itâ€™s not like we donâ€™t want to use it or anything.

name: Kaiser Permanente

This app has a rating of 17+ which means my teen cannot even get it on her phone to receive all the appointment notifications and test results. How in the world am I supposed to manage the health care of my "minor" child who is not old enough to manage her own? Ridiculous.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Can't pay premium. Waste.

name: Kaiser Permanente

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Worst app ever
text: Why doesn't this app support iPhone Plus devices? It's outragously poor - worst designed app I have ever used in my life.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Kaiser is going downhill fast
text:
Update: as a stage three cancer patient I listen more diligently these days to my body signals.  After several days of abdominal pain I went to see a primary care physician (not my regular one, he was not available for several weeks). The guy I did see wasn't sure what I had so he put me on antibiotics.  Two weeks later with no improvement and I call to make a urology appointment. The next available appointment is over a month out. The socialized medicine horror stories that you read about from Europe and Canada have now  arrived at our front door.  Now we will all see what free healthcare is all about. 

Original review:
So let's recap.  Premiums tripled, phone hold times between 30-50 minutes, check in lines quadrupled, specialty appointments that used to take a week now take 4-6 weeks to schedule, doctors and nurses leaving in droves and now the app is falling apart.  Thanks for staying in Obamacare, Kaiser, and screwing all of your old patients.  

Can't reply to doctor or nurse information.  OK and Send buttons missing.  Prescription refill problems.  All kinds of glitches that were not there before.  Kaiser is heading downhill fast.  I see various doctors frequently because of my medical issues. They say that workload has increased, seasoned doctors snd nurses are leaving, and they cannot find enough competent talent to backfill the positions. 

Kaiser used to be great.  A few years of Obamacare and it has all been ruined.  Kaiser is one of only two providers still in the GA exchange. All of us long-term patients have really been screwed by their poor decisions.  Skyrocketing premiums with dwindling services.

name: Kaiser Permanente

I did not get an email, alert for my app, or a text message. I had to call the pharmacy to find out. Since I use the app, it makes sense that I would receive an alert that my meds were ready. I guess that makes too much sense.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Not A Very Written App
text: Compared to online computer App, this App's Messages feature is not very useful. In messages you can't go from reading your doctor's message to writing a message without exiting their message to write yours. After you write a message you don't know if it has been sent or received.

title: Update broke the app

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE & UNRELIABLE
text: Sssuuuccchhh a horrible app! It literally won't let you make an appointment!!! Like, customers pay an insane amount of money for their healthcare and aren't able to make an appointment!!!??? How many people got discouraged in doing so and ended up in a worse and more unhealthy situation? So sad.

name: Kaiser Permanente

name: Kaiser Permanente

text: Fatal flaw with recent upgrade. Cannot refill meds. This was such a great app. Please fix.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Lost all functionality
text:
This app used to work great, but since a couple updates ago, it's unusable. Previously to schedule an appointment I could just list my doctor and it would give me a list of available appointments, I'd pick the one that worked for me and ta-da, done. Now it gives you a calendar and asks you to pick a date, and then tells you it can't schedule an appointment for the listed reasons (no reasons listed). I'm assuming it's because there's none available that day, but who even knows. It only takes a few attempts of choosing dates at random before I accidentally click "done," close out of the entire appointment scheduler, and give up. 

Likewise, the pharmacy has been completely broken since the last update. It shows my list of prescriptions, but there's no way to add them to the cart. So again, completely useless. This app went from being super easy to completely useless.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Works well
text: This is a rare app that's about as fast as the website and can get most things done. Touch ID works fine so the complaints about that inaccurate in my experience.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: A little buggy and could use more work, but still helpful
text: To start, to fix the Touch ID feature, go to your settings (on the bottom left tab) and re-enable Touch ID. That fixed it for me. Anyway more features could be used or brought to the app, such as the drug encyclopedia as well as the list of common diseases and Kaiser's methods of treating them. Otherwise the app is ok.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: What happened?!
text: Suddenly the Kaiser Permanente app will not use Touch ID to open on my iPad. The app also no longer shows in my purchased apps or even when I search for it in the Apple App Store on my iPad. Very frustrating and disappointing.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Great!
text:
No idea why there are so many complaints about fingerprint access in this release, it works jus fine, as it has since they implemented the fingerprint login. Sounds like user error to me.

Love being able to manage my whole family's medical needs via the app - can see past visit documentation, make appointments, email my doctor/pharmacist, check my lab results, and refill my medications, each just a few clicks away from the dashboard.

text: I have a super secure password just for KP randomly generated by 1Password, but since I can't paste it in, I changed my KP password to my old AOL password. Now it's super-easy to remember!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Password Issues
text:
As others have already talked about - if you use a password manager, you know to create and manage complex passwords, then you are out of luck.  You cannot copy/paste into the app.  

As a lastpass user, the app is beyond my ability to use - as I cannot remember a 26 character password to enter manually each time.  I guess I could weaken my password greatly, just so that I could remember/key it in.  But isn't that poor practice?

Also, the password verifier on the TouchID setting will not accept the same password that allows me to log in. The security and consistency are really lacking on this latest version.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Cumbersome appointment scheduling feature
text: The only scheduling the app allows is with the user's primary care provider; no other associated physicians are available through the app. This is in contrast to the messaging service where all associated physicians are shown. In order to schedule an appointment with that primary care provider, the application asks if the user would like to schedule a "non-physical appointment within two days" or a "non-physical appointment in the future." As if those two options aren't both in the future, it then prompts for a date range regardless of which option the user chooses. This actually happens twice for the "in the future" option. Why ask the user if they'd like an appointment within two days then ask for a date range again? The final step is the most aggravating. If the user's specified date range doesn't return an available appointment slot, they have to completely start over. Why don't you suggest a date or time, or show the available dates in the first place? Scheduling has been this way since I downloaded the app about a year ago. KP, fix this please.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Works fine for me
text:
I always have a little bit of dread when I open an app and it requires I update to use it. In this case, the update was completely transparent. The app works just as well as before, which happens to be pretty darn good.

I've had no problems emailing my doctor, or viewing old test results (some prior reviews said they couldn't do these).

I am using this on an iPhone 6 Plus, and I find a perfectly easy to read and use, and I feel like the app makes fairly good use of the real estate. It could compress things a bit more and fit more information on the screen, but it's good enough.

The app works fine for me. As for the general comments of Kaiser services going downhill in one or two of the reviews, I have found it pretty much just as easy to get appointments with my PCP or specialist as I ever have been able to in NorCal, where I have been with Kaiser for 13 years. Maybe it's a regional thing.

title: Something very wrong
text: This app has all the benefit of a video game.  Every time I try to order my prescription by mail, nothing happens and the meds show up again as "available to fill." I'm not in a Kaiser area while they're open, so mail order is the only way I can legally obtain these.  Meanwhile, my health problems are coming back without the medications.  Is it the app?  The pharmacy?  The internet?  Using this app gets me nothing but frustrated.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Crashes
text: Works fine as it has for a while now... except latest version may not be playing well with iOS 10. Crashes when you hit send button when sending a message to your doctor.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Pretty good for a healthcare provider
text:
Sadly, I am no longer a Kaiser member due to a change in employers (I love Kaiser). Overall, the app is pretty good but not great. It provides access to your future and past appointments with after visit summaries, lab results, immunization records, messages from your doctor, an electronic representation of the membership card and much more.

Some of the functionality just seems to be a web page embedded inside the app, some features look native.

What would make the app delightful, and 5 star worthy, are the seemingly small details and features. Below is my feature wishlist. I know, it's not always easy to make this sort of stuff happen, especially in the healthcare environment where HIPAA compliance and the bureaucracy that comes with it can slow down the easiest tasks. 

1. The app doesn't particularly look great on large screen iPhones.
2. While the electronic membership card is embedded inside the app, it would be even better if Kaiser provided an Apple Wallet membership card.
3. HealthKit integration: I wanted to import my medical record into the Health app. Unfortunately, the app doesn't provide an easy way to do so. I tried to import the health summary XML file that Kaiser provides on its website. Sadly, the Health app was unable to read it.  I have successfully imported HL7 XML files from other providers, so I know it works.
4. Move more of the interface from webviews into native views.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Prescription refill bug
text:
After choosing the pharmacy in which to pick up your prescription, it does not load the next page or otherwise offer you a button to move onto the next page. Fix your bugs, Kaiser!

I am reiterating my original complaint. They will let you choose the pharmacy. They give you a select button with which to select what pharmacy you would like to pick up your prescription at. Then there is no next button. There is no logical way to get onto the next page. There are only three buttons available, none of them The next button, nor any other button to get it onto the next page. The only three buttons available to you after the select your pharmacy to pick up your prescription page is: "back", "cancel" (I assume that the "cancel" Button is essentially the same as the back button in terms of results), and then there is the "search" button, with which to search and select the pharmacy from. 

Please fix your bugs, Kaiser!

title: Please bring back Touch ID on iPhones!
text: Easier and more efficient to use Touch ID as opposed to typing out a password every time.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Aewsome!!
text: Touch login works perfectly, fast and does not freeze or crash, VERY convenient!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: I am a fan!
text: I was happy and excited to find this app. I am able to access my medical info, make an appt and locate facilities in seconds. Well done KP, keep up the good work!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Fail
text: App won't even open.... I went to message my doctor and it crashes before it even opens. Boooo! Was great before the update.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Easy to use
text: I was able to email my doctor, make an appointment and refill my medicine with the Mail order pharmacy. Quick and easy.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Worthless
text:
This app is incomplete. I tried to make an appointment and it says I must answer questions, but there is no question there.
I tried to enter a reason for visit and that bounced me back. I one time it allowed me to enter a date then asked for another date. No appointment available but didn't give me any options to continue. Just start over. It should have suggested a future date or a different Doctor. Some idea that might result in future success. 
Kaiser is getting too big and multilayered bureaucracy too complex. I will call or email my Primary Care Physician and get in appointment in two days.
Don't waste an hour with this app like I did...for nothing!!!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: What happened :(
text:
I loved this app when it first came out. I could refill prescriptions, see all my test results, send/receive emails, and make appointments. Then recently all of my prescriptions showed there were no refills and that still hasn't changed. If I try to use the RX number it won't go through either. I have now started to just go into the pharmacy, request my refill and wait. :-( I spoke to the pharmacy and they told me their system changed and they realize it doesn't speak to the phone app. That was around the start of 2016 that I heard that. Now we are at mid 2016.... Is a fix in sight?

I thought that was the only problem, but now I am having problems with test results. I can see every test done in 2015 and older. I just had a bunch of 2016 bloodwork done and it showed up at first, but then I realized that after I looked at my results the tests disappeared. The 2016 data just seems to be gone. Even when I view an old test that shows a history of all other results it only goes to 2015. This was a disappointment. Hopefully the appointment and email features continue to work. I keep looking for a new app. Please fix this!!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Touch ID

name: Kaiser Permanente

I had to quit using the old app bc it wouldn't let me order prescriptions by mail.  I'll call member services tomorrow to see why apps still don't work

name: Kaiser Permanente

Most of the functionality on the website doesn't exist here. It's particularly frustrating if you have minor children who's accounts you're trying to manage. You have to go to the website to manage their information, so the app is superfluous and frustrating.

Pass.

name: Kaiser Permanente

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: It used to be good
text:
This app was useful when it first came out. Appointments were easy to make, messaging the Dr was easier, and managing prescriptions and refills were easy. However, the app seems to get less useful with each update. Now I can no longer make an appointment for same-next day, they're always for one or two weeks in the future which is not helpful at all! I can't even hit reply to a doctor's message without composing a new message altogether (again, useless). The only thing I use this for is to look at my existing appointments, tests results, and prescriptions. 

I hope there are updates to IMPROVE this app in the future. Until then, this app is getting 2 starts.

name: Kaiser Permanente

I know it's the weight user name and password because I can log in on my PC with no problem. Trying to figure out the problem I got my self lucked out, long story short now I have to wait 3 to 7 business days to gat my password in the mail.

name: Kaiser Permanente

name: Kaiser Permanente

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: A For Effort
text: This app works slow as molasses and has been for years now. The quaintly is extremely poor all around, from the looks of the app, to the way information is uploaded and downloaded, I believe we all spend a lot of money on our premium a month for Kaiser to spend a lot of the money they get towards updating this app big time. I am just saying, sure a lot of you can agree? So let's see this app improve in speed, on sending and receiving messages from your provider(s), if you upload a photo or your doctor uploads a photo to you, that you are more than able to see the photo both ways. Come on now Kaiser, yet with the program and get it right. Cause my Bank of America app is far better than yours.

name: Kaiser Permanente

Enables patient to reorder Rx's conveniently, pull up test results, and contact doctor with ease. That's about what I expected.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Additions
text:
If you'd write some code that would allow third party calendars to scan the app it would be great.

I'd like to be able to sync between my iCal and kp.org app. That way the upcoming appointments would show up on all my iOS devices, allowing for alarms and notifications of upcoming appointments. 

Also, if somehow you could incorporate the more information into the upcoming appointments it would be great. 

For example if I'm seeing Dr. Park in Woodland Hills, not only would I like to see the time, date and address, but how about building and or room number? 

I've had all sorts of appointments this year and the app has been a life saver. That said these small improvements would make it much better.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Doesn't work half the time
text: Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't. Several times it has asked me to come back because it was not working. Unreliable. They need to get some app builders to work on it. An app is not just a website reduced in size. The user experience and user interface is not user friendly.

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: So convenient!!
text: This KP app is amazing. We've had KP for years and I've always used KP.org, but this takes convenience to a whole new level! It's phenomenal how much information is at your fingertips, and the design is well thought-out. Very easy to use even for those who are not tech-savvy. Would be nice to be able to make appointments with other specialties, but other than that it's perfect!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Pretty good but needs work
text: The app works good and has a lot. My main gripe is that appointments don't give you full details. The address was missing the "south" so the gps took me to the wrong place. Also, a building number should really be included when it's in a complex. Notifications would be nice too.

name: Kaiser Permanente

Also please put the "go the cart" button at the top of the top of the pharmacy screen so you don't have to scroll all the way to bottom to find it. Also it does not work on KP wifi!

name: Kaiser Permanente
title: Why can't I find a location?
text:
Have loved my app for most things. Seeing lab results, and making appointments without calling in (when it works). It has some pretty terrible glitches and should defiantly work better at getting information that is requested. The last appointment that I scheduled through the app disappeared and it was a really good thing I went to it to check my appointment time so that I could schedule the time off work. After I didn't see it listed in upcoming appointments anymore I called and rescheduled the same appointment saving me zero time. 
I wanted to get a facility address and went to the locator and typed in Portland or and got zero results. I then added a specific zip code thinking that would help. Still not a single listing came up. What a joke. If you can't use it then why even have it as an option?

For example, we had a significant medical emergency in our household on Christmas day. While I am able to view claims as they are processed from that health event, even after the start of the new year, I canâ€™t view the overall deductible/out-of-pocket expenses tracker for 2017. name: myCigna
title: MJM
text:
Love this app! My favorite part is that it makes it so easy to review recent claims: I can choose parameters for what I want to review. For example, I can choose to review only medical claims for me in the last 30 days. Or I can review only dental claims for my daughter within the last 90 days. I can further specify only paid claims, or those that were denied, being processed, being appealed, or have been adjusted, etc. I also love that I can "Live Chat" if I have a question. 
Three suggestions for improvement: 
1. Make "Live Chat" available 24/7 (or see #2)
2. Allow me to send a message/ask a question to be answered by customer service via return message the next day. 
3. Allow me to see status of requests for pre-certification/preauthorization. For example, after my doctor submits a request, I'd like to be able to see if it was received, if it's under review, whether or not the request was approved or denied, and the reason for that decision. 
Thank you Cigna!

When I called in the first time the agent transferred me right away to Cigna medical customer service before even understanding what issue I had. The second agent was better, but his solution - delete and reinstall the app. Sad.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: This app DOES allow you to paste password at login
text:
Almost didn't bother downloading the app due to a review below that claimed the app prevented pasting passwords into the login field. I just successfully logged in with no problems whatsoever. I pasted a long, complex password from my eWallet app. I'm using an iPhone 6s on iOS 10.2 

So far the app appears to be very well designed. Haven't vetted it thoroughly but wanted to clarify the above information.

Upon opening the app for the first time, I was asked to either create account or sign in. I thought I had an account so proceeded to choose sign in. After the login failed I attempted to go back to create an account - which proved very difficult as there were no breadcrumbs for me to go back or options in the hamburger menu.

Closing the app didn't work either.

name: Blue Shield of California

Usually I copy it from 1Password to paste in a login form, but the people making this app decided they would disallow pasting in the password field. Well, now I'm not gonna go in and manually type in my complex password, thanks a lot. Almost as bad as banks not allowing me to paste an account number.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: App is So very Slow
text: The app is pretty cool as far as healthcare companies go. However, it is very very slow. After you put in your username/password (why can't this be remembered or use Touch ID?) and tap the blue 'Log In' button, it takes you to the main screen w/ 4 green boxes, but the 'thinking' pinwheel literally takes 1:08:60 until you can actually use the app. After it finally loads and you tap, for example, the ID card button, when you go back to the main screen it again takes 1:00:30. It's not network speed. It is far too slow and needs to be fixed.

It's not like anyone would acquire a password vault company for $110 million, right?

title: Sooooooo sllllllooooooooowwwww
text:
1) The app takes forever to load anything. I usually just need to get to my ID card, and this takes upwards of 30s - 1min each time,
2) I can't paste my password in the Password field, which makes it impossible to use in a secure way with a password locker (I have had to use an easy to remember, generic password against the advice of pretty much everyone)
3) Please support Apple Wallet/Passbook. I usually just need to get to my ID card, and launching the app is painful. If I could just store the ID card in wallet, it would save me a lot of time.

As such, I either have to create a weak password that I can remember and easily type in, or not use this app on a mobile device.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Horrible login experience
text:
I use unique passwords everywhere. I can't remember them all. So I use a well known password app to help me maintain those passwords. Now, I am trying to use your app on a mobile device. Why do you assume I will be in front of a computer to look at my password to enter it in the password field of the login page? 

I should be able to copy my password from the tool I use and paste it into the login screen. Unfortunately, if I switch back and forth, you clear out the field as soon as I try to start typing again when I come back to your app. This is a horrible mobile experience.

name: Blue Shield of California

name: Blue Shield of California
title: A complete embarrassment
text:
This is truly one of the most godawful apps I've ever used. I would rather breakdance naked over shards of broken glass than ever log into this monstrosity again. Can't paste in my password, making it insecure. Doesn't save my login name. No Touch ID support. No way to display your ID card or save to Passbook. Design is grotesque and responsiveness is awful.

Fire your entire team. Hire someone who actually owns an iPhone. Try again.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Improvements necessary
text: This app is a bit useless, can they please add a 'card' file so I won't have to carry my insurance card around with me. I'm not sure why this app always log out of my account and why it can't save my user ID like someone will steal this information from my phone? Come on Blue Shield fix this app and improve it asap...

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Lousy Application
text:
1. What is the point of telling users to create secure, difficult to guess passwords and then not permitting the users to copy from a security application and past into the app? This just makes people go to simple, easy-to-type passwords.

2. After finally getting logged in, why tell Medicare Supplement customers they have to log in through Safari? Edit your app description in the store to indicate it isn't usable for Medicare patients.

Bad planning and programming.
