name: myCigna
title: Cigna App
text: Great app!! It puts all of my insurance info right at my fingertips. It also allows me to see what claims are pending or have been paid/ processed and how much I am responsible for so that I can budget for the Drs bill before I get it;  Allows me to see how much of my deductible or maximums I've reached; Allows me to see exactly WHAT is covered under my preventative plan for both medical and dental; Allows me to see what a specific medication will cost me via mail or at my nearest pharmacies, etc. so I can decide where I want to buy it;  Allows me to search for a lab and the cost of a test or procedure to me so that I can decide if I want to have it done at a lab, Drs office, hospital, etc.; also really love that I can enter specific health info in my "wallet" if I want to keep track of my prescriptions, allergies, immunizations etc.  I'm a little leery of ALL my business being on the app so I really just input my immunizations info on there.  As a travel nurse I need to keep up with my immunization record, influenza shots, etc and it becomes a pain having to search for the info all the time.  VERRRRY COOL and TREMENDOUSLY HELPFUL app!!

name: myCigna
title: Insurance made Easier
text:
"My Cigna" by a standard PC was convenient and easier, but with this app, being on top of your plan from every aspect has been made even more easier!  I love it.  

I can keep track of all my medical care, cost (if any), doctor's names and telephone numbers, and benefits. At a touch of my phone or iPad I have access to my questions, incentives rewards, and much more.  If for some reason my question has no answers here, I have telephone numbers that hook me up with the right specialist who can help answer my questions. Do you seek advice from their RNs on call?  It's there in the app. Phone numbers to assist you. Are you on vacation and need to go to Urgent Care or a doctor?  The app assist you with that too. Can't remember you doctor's phone number, or the spelling of their name?  Good news, it's all stored in the app to make life and those times of illness or accidents a bit easier so you can focus on getting better.

There is even a simple consent page with gives you and your spouse reciprocal access to the other's information.  For me that alone is invaluable.  

 Bravo Cigna!

name: myCigna
title: Too many mistakes to depend on as a usable app
text:
The only part of this app that I found to be usable, is a listing and address book of pharmacies in my area.

Using the "price a drug" area has been very misleading, and is often dead wrong. This specific area will commonly tell you that you can fill a 90 day order at a local pharmacy; this is almost never correct.

The drug mail order status area has too little detail.  For instance, a drug may be "in process" for many days. A phone call is required to find out what the problem is, completely negating the ease of use of this app. 

Also, the mail order status area will often list tracking numbers. I have found that some tracking numbers have no status for more than a week. I can only assume that a specific prescription was set to ship out on a certain date, but for some unknown reason is not sent.

I have also sent in prescriptions to be filled, only to find out a few weeks later that I had to call in and "release the order" for no reason whatsoever that could be explained to me.

These are just a few of the few dozen problems I have run into trying to use this app. I am very glad their customer service number is 7/24.

name: myCigna
title: Very Convenient.
text:
Overall, this is a great app. I simply wanted it so I could easily review my family's claims. I, too, had the issue with my password not working, but I reset it and it works fine now. There's a feature I haven't checked out fully yet, but seems very helpful -- Health Wallet. This feature allows you to store specific health info for each person on your plan. 

The ONLY inconvenience I've run across so far is this... When there are multiple charges on one claim, the app shows the discount for each charge, but does not add them up in the end. I either have to pull it up on the computer for that total charge or pull out my calculator and figure it out myself.

name: myCigna
title: Physician rates CIGNAHEALTHSPRINGS - heâ€™s back
text:
Update: Am I the only one having to battle Part D Medicare Drug Insurance? Almost a year later (v.i.) in formal written (forget useless phone calls) appeals, grievances, state insurance commission complaints, appeal to U.S. Senator for help, complaint with CMS (the official Medicare â€œcustodianâ€� and ombudsman), my case has yet to be resolved. CIGNA HEALTHSPRINGSRX owes me thousands in DIRECT MEMBER REIMBURSEMENT for out of pocket expenses.  I hold approvals for reimbursement â€” basically promissory notes â€” but the battle rages.  Next is a court battle.  

 I suppose negative stars are verboten... The CIGNA app won't let me sign in. Customer support by phone gives friendly reps, a "ticket" #, NO action. For weeks, appealed denials change the reasons for denial -- prior authorization required or NOT, drug not on formulary when clearly shown on website.  Appeals continue.  State insurance commissioner next up. (Impossible to rate 0 & still submit review.)

name: myCigna
title: Good app, getting better.
text: I'm not sure where all these reviews are coming from. My app has always worked fine. Was always able to login etc. login errors only occurred when I was in a little to no service zone. Ability to export ID card to Apple wallet would be good, as well as Touch ID. It would also be helpful to improve the incentives area. On the website, you are taken to a site where you can connect your wearable devices, earn points and incentives that way. But there is no way to check your progress / sync with your device through the mobile app. Because of that I'm sure most people don't even know that feature exists.

name: myCigna
title: Settings>Restrictions>Websites: Always Allow >Add a Website
text: If you get a never ending loading page look behind the cycling circle for the dark grey text on the grey background for the web site that is attempting to load. I keep my websites restricted and often am prompted in such situations by a legitimate app going to a legitimate site to add this to the exceptions list of web sites allowed. I was not prompted as I simply just added the web site to the exceptions list found in: Settings>Restrictions>Websites: Always Allow >Add a Websiteâ€¦ I hope this helps some people would were having issues with the app. This so far is the only manual work around that other apps have taken stride by the afore mentioned automatic prompting to â€œAdd a Websiteâ€�.

name: myCigna
title: So Helpful
text: This app is great! Tells you everything you need to know. You can see how much money you have spent and how much you have left. You can also list all medications, allergies and medical conditions on there for quick references. It also is a digital card so you will always have your medical card on you at all times. Sometimes you might need it unexpectedly. Another great feature is that you can look up dr offices, emergency rooms, urgent cares, lab etc on here too that are in network. This app is really easy to navigate and figure out. Enjoy it. Hopefully you don't have to use it as much as I do. â�¤ï¸�

name: myCigna
title: Frustrated!
text:
Haven't been able to get past login screen. Enter my password and then...nothing. Deleted app & then added it again. And...nothing. Not helpful when you're on the go trying to access information when not by your laptop or a computer. ğŸ‘�ğŸ‘�

Just called the 800 # provided on the app for tech support. I submitted a complaint and advised them of the issues and notified them about other reviews and complaints I read on the App Store. They gave me a srvc ticket # and "should" hear bk fr them in 2 business days. I wasn't expecting it to be resolved tonight but at least they're aware of the problem. Who knows if they'll take my complaint seriously. The cost of health insurance is ridiculous...the least they could have is a functional app to minimize the frustration.

name: myCigna
title: Helps me keep track of everything
text:
I have many health issues, and this App makes my life a lot easier. 
The Pros:
-The app keeps me up to date on  my Copay and deductible limits for me and the family. 
-Cigna covers my LTD claim as well, and with this app I have access to all of my coverage through Cigna. 
-everything I want to know is easily accessible, I can find doctors who are in network, and more importantly those that aren't. I can also see when a check has been cut for my LTD, no need to go to multiple sites.
-It helps me to keep Cigna on their toes in regards to mistakes made by them or my providers rather than being notified months later with a bill. 
Cons:
-Updates take longer to post.
-It has a tendency to freeze up or not allow you to sign in which generally happens after changes have been made and you have to contact mobile support to fix the glitch.

Overall I think the app is a great tool, much easier than the full site and I use it several times a week.

name: myCigna
title: Convenient but needs more
text: Love the ability to house my insurance card and quickly email or fax the information directly from within the app. However the prescription ordering needs work. There is nothing in place to alert you if there is an error with your order. I placed an order in early December and when it didn't arrive a few weeks later I went back to the app. It was only then that I noticed there was an issue with the order. It would have been great to get an immediate notification from the app that there was an issue. Also would love Touch ID.

name: myCigna
title: Unstable
text: The context and tools of this application are helpful when you do not have to input a lot of information or change between categories often. I find the application is slightly unstable in that entering contacts, checking claims, reviewing coverages, the application freezes during the process. At times, it will come around and other times,  you are forced to quit the process and application and start all over again. Connectivity is another issue, with connection in poor reception area, the application will stop responding even when you have moved into a stronger reception area - this is also frustrating and needs to be addressed by the developers.

name: myCigna
title: Cliff Notes for Health Insurance???
text:
My understanding when given our new health insurance was the online site was for basically selling the policies and such. The app was represented as "for the member."
Over 6 weeks passed as I struggled to locate a new team of doctors when relocating from out of state.  After calling the member number several times, they directed me to the website for physicians and services in my area. My complaint is definitely not the agents at Cigna, those ladies I spoke with went over and above to straighten out a problem and point me in the right direction. 
This app on the other hand is basically cliff notes of general info with no meat and certainly no potatoes!

name: myCigna
title: Access and fax your insurance cards
text:
Having all 4 of my families insurance cards quickly accessible in an app that can then instantly fax any of those cards from INSIDE THE APP is priceless. They just saved my wallet a quarter inch of space. I have had no connectivity issues so far. Aetna and Bluecross, at the time, had no such app- this is considerably better than those providers. User eXperience and UI seem to be given heavy thought. It is very intuitive.

People seem to either give it 5-stars or 1-star.

name: myCigna
title: Works
text: Does what it is supposed to when it is supposed to. Used this for checking claims when the hospital called to collect on something insurance was still processing. I could tell them what was being paid by insurance and details regarding the payment. Helpful when I added my infant and his insurance card wasn't in hand yet so I pulled it up on the app. Not a Cigna fan in general but this app has made it much easier. Now if only I could get what I need timely from their customer service dept.

name: myCigna
title: Extremely useful and easy on the eye
text: This app truly takes me light years ahead of where I was prior to using it regarding my knowledge of my own health insurance. The most useful part to me is the ability to track how close I am to meeting my deductible. Also, extremely useful are seeing any claims (paid/processed/...) as well as having my entire family id card's. I took one star off because the wallet button caused the app to crash twice the two times I used it, but it doesn't have as much useful info on it so it hardly matters.

name: myCigna
title: Worst app ever!
text: Cigna had to fax my Dr for an authorization for a script refill.  I found out 10 days later that the dr either never received the fax or never responded to it.  I called Cigna and was told a letter was sent to inform me of such via snail mail.  I said it could take 2 or 3 weeks to find out the Dr hasn't responded during which time I would run out of meds!!  I was told I could always check the app where I would have seen the letter.  I checked and not true.  Tech support told me they post no letters in the app.  Right hand doesn't know what the left hand is doing there!!  Also, the app shows we have 0 orders in the the last 90 days, when we have lots of orders!  Terrible app, terrible customer service!

name: myCigna
title: Decent & Unreliable
text:
Decent:
Surprising amount of physician and medical procedure information is available to the user once one learns where to find it in the application. 

Because the app requires users to log in with their unique name and password, one would expect to be able to see "coverage specific information" to their plan, unfortunately that is not the case; only the more general coverage summaries are available.

Unreliable:
The app is clearly maintained by developers with little experience in large database/mobile app integration. 

When the application does connect it can be very slow, very sloooow. Sometimes inbox will have a message that a section of the app may not be accessible at that time - probably due to upgrades and API development - to be expected given the infrastructure size and various databases being integrated - it's going to be a long haul to get this all working.

Frequently the app can NOT connect at all.

name: myCigna
title: Excellent app - easy to use
text:
For a health insurance company, I was expecting this app to be terribly confusing and not work half the time.
To my surprise, this app functions extremely well and, in some ways, is much easier to use than the website! If you just want to check a claim or balance or even get your card info when you're in an medical facility, this is an extremely convenient option!

I'm very impressed with this app. Too bad car insurance companies are so far behind, Cigna is on the right track!

name: myCigna
title: World Class Cigna Service
text: Cigna is offering world class service to their customers by investing in a multi-dimensional, multi-functional app. Every feature on the mycigna website is readily available on the app, and it all functions quite well. I've never had any technological issues, and I log in at least once a week to search for an in-network provider, check my HSA balance, or review an explanation of benefits for myself or another family member.

name: myCigna
title: Glad to have remote access... but...
text:
A great app for CIGNA customers - and certainly helpful - whenever they stop "tweaking" it and changing the types of data available. Last month's tweak disabled our ability to view our out-of-pocket spending, and while that returned today, it's now impossible to view our Wallet. 

Love that there are so very many sorting options (now that our spending options have popped up again), since sorting by open claims is far easier than skimming through still-processing older claims. It's also a blessing to be able to jump to EOBs on the run - especially at a hospital or doc's office. 

BUT...

Would you just please stop changing key items weekly? Set one day a month to make significant updates - please! It's hard enough to keep up with a critically-ill family member's insurance situation without relearning the app so frequently!

name: myCigna
title: Love it!!!!
text: I really love this app it is easy to read and understand and very helpful finding doctors around the area. I love it the only thing i don't like is that I am not able to see claims from my children since the account is mine and there is no option to see the other people under the same insurance, in another apps you can see all members claims once you log in. Specially if my children can't create an account because they are not old enough. But besides that I'm very happy with a app :)

name: myCigna
title: Login Fails
text:
I have been singing a member for a few years now and this app used to work fine. Recently and trying to login and it gave me a error message and directed me to contact the service department. I contacted them and after a lengthy call was told to wait for response from them. They responded by telling me that my account is still being "Set up" and that I would not be able to use the application until that had been finished. 

This makes no sense as I've been able to use the application in the past and able to log into the website fine. When I informed the service associate of the specs they failed to respond and have left me in limbo.

name: myCigna
title: Love This App
text: It has been very helpful to me lately as I have had many problems with my family claims.  It's been nice to lookup and keep an eye on.  However, since last update, in the app only, I no longer have access to my entire family's history.  I can only see mine, even though it states I have shared access.  Online I am fine.  Also it would be nice to have access to EOBs through the app...maybe in a later version.  Please correct the app so I can see my entire family and have the shared access it shows I should have.  Thanks.

name: myCigna
title: Good, not great
text:
The dental app process provides all the information one needs. It is not hard to use.  However, it could be great if it was not quite so segmented.  Have to go to more places than required to get some basic information.  There should be a summary type page that give all the YTD information regarding processed claims.  Than, should I want details, let me drill down.  

Overall, still a very good app and an easy way to get information.  I will use it because it does the job!

name: myCigna
title: Plz fix the app and reduce the call wait time
text:
Could someone please fix the app? It crashes about 50 percent of the time. Touch ID is very buggy and it requires me click on the password bar to activate it.

It takes at least 3 - 5 seconds for most things to load. The find doctors feature is very difficult to use. It took me forever to add my doctor to the list. I had to scroll for minutes. I could only sort doctors by their names.

I was trying to understand how my HRA account balance was calculated. There's little to no explanation. Actually no explanation why withdraws were made. I decided to call the support number since there were a number of withdraws I just didn't understand. 

The support line is probably the most exasperating part. It used to be super responsive, but I had to wait for 30 minutes before I could speak to a live person. The service person is helpful and nice as always, but the path to get to him was not an experience I want to go through ever again.

name: myCigna
title: Designed to Fail??
text: Just another weak link in the chain.  I'm not sure if this app wasn't tested or is written by an isolated department, but its points of failure are many.  From login, to chat, to storing personal information, to coordinating referrals, to getting accurate information on providers...this software is unreliable!  If one were to follow "conspiracy theory" it seems that CIGNA wants you to fail with this tedious and unreliable process that can damage your information that you've saved elsewhere in the CIGNA system.  Maybe CIGNA doesnt want to pay you and this is a way to mess things up so badly that their process is too difficult to follow or you just give up.  VERY DISAPPOINTED!!

name: myCigna
title: Ok Sometimes
text:
Crap. Every time I try to sign in it tells me sorry try again later. Try again and it logs in. Just stupid! Prescription ordering sounds like a great idea and it would be if I didn't end up having to call Cigna for over half the prescriptions I need to order. Too many say 'Order can't be completed' with no explanation of why. Calling Cigna is even more frustrating than the app, I know, hard to believe. Wish this app just worked, like the Walgreens app, which always worked great for me. Can't use it anymore as Cigna wants to have control of everything. 
Make it work or let me order my prescriptions from Walgreens, please.

name: myCigna
title: Up to date information!
text:
I was looking for my current claims and they all were there including those from five days ago!

Best of all I'm able to store my 12 prescriptions so I don't have to keep writing them down every time I see a new doctor or go to the ER.  So many other great areas within the app I am blown away. I have never had an issue accessing especially from my phone great job!

name: myCigna
title: Comprehensive & Awesome!!
text: Not sure why so many bad reviews. In my opinion, this app is awesome!! It contains everything I thought to look for and more, from claims tracking, HRA account payments and balance, a copy of my ID cards and coverage information. It stores my doctor's info, my health info and much more. This app is quite comprehensive, is quite intuitive and works quite smoothly. It deserves 5 stars without a doubt!!

name: myCigna
title: So much information!
text: The app used to lack in what it was capable of and here in the last year they have really stepped up their game! I love that I can pull up medications right in the doctors office to check them against my coverage so we can decide if a medication is affordable before I leave instead of leaving with it and having a shock at the pharmacy making me have to do a return visit!

name: myCigna
title: New Claim & Prescription Refill
text: I went to Google like normal to get on Cigna website to order a refill, like I have in the past and it said to view the app.  I went crap, I just wanted to order a refill not download an app.  To my surprise, it downloaded fast and I signed on to the website. I am so very impressed with the ease of access to claims, refills, etc.  Thank you for making my life so much easier!

name: myCigna
title: User friendly
text: I really like this app. I've not encountered issues with finding participating doctors but our family doesn't have to go a whole lot. I have used this function and found it helpful. I find it very user friendly and I LOVE being able to monitor claims and deductibles for my family. And thanks so much for having Touch ID! That's always a plus for me.

name: myCigna
title: My incentives
text: I agree with everyone else, the interface is awesome. I haven't explored too much but I have found it difficult to find a doctor. I'm trying to just find a PCP for regular check up! In addition, each time I've tried to check out the incentives it hasn't worked and keeps coming up with the same error message. This has happened on the webpage and through the app. Once these issues are resolved (or there is a how to use video) it'll have 5 stars!

name: myCigna
title: Looms promising:needs work.
text: Layout is very nice, easy to use except I get the feeling it should be able to do more. Nothing auto-populates with your plan information or identification information, no future or past appointment history comes up, no indication of home clinics. I feel that this should be available, perhaps it's a HIPA issue tho. With some work this could be a fantastic app. For now it's a pretty shell: barely functional.

name: myCigna
title: This app does a whole lot to say so little...
text: There are only several functions on this app, track your account balance, check to see if claims are paid and see who you can or cannot make an appointment with. Other than that trying to look up useful information like is a hearing aid covered leads you down an endless loop to know where. I cannot even look up doctors I have used in the past for special needs because their records only let you go back so far.  Sorry I only need a bone dr when I break something and I can't say I see that guy every year...

name: myCigna
title: Good App - Could Use a Few Improvements
text:
It is a nice and handy app that gives you quick access to most things that are on-line. It is nice to be able to view Claims and Refill a Prescription via the app.

I ran into one issue with the app. It would not let me log in even though I was using the correct information. I was able to log in via the web site though without issue. I needed to use the Forgot My Password link in the app and "re-create" my password and then it started working again.

I would also like to suggest that they come out with an iPad version of the app. I would think that there would be one for the iPad by this time. It would also be nice if Touch ID was enabled for signing into the app.

- Merg

name: myCigna
title: Highly useful App
text: I love this app! I can use it anytime anywhere and get claims information, benefit information or anything that I'm looking for at the time. I can go in and check my out-of-pocket maximum and deductible amounts while I'm at the doctors office. That way I don't overpay anyone nor do I underpay. Everybody should use this app because it is really helpful and easy to manage!

name: myCigna
title: Best Insurance App Out There
text: This app is great. It's probably the best insurance app out there. Minimal crashes, incredibly up to date information, and very easy to use. This app provides very useful, decision making, information like: an individual and family deductible tracker, provider directory, flex spending tracker, stored insurance cards, and many other useful features.

name: myCigna
title: Canâ€™t add doctors from directory to built-in contact list???
text: This app might be fine for on-the-co checking of coverage and paperwork, but why on earth would I enter anybody in the â€œCONTACTSâ€� list by hand? I have all my doctors in my regular address book already, so either this app-specific list should allow importing of iOS address book entries, or better yet, have an â€œADD TO CONTACTSâ€� button for each of the doctors in your searchable directory. Right now, I can search for a doctor but canâ€™t save my favorites/search results.

name: myCigna
title: Last ver was better
text: This new version does not show claims as well as the last version or the online web page. It makes a big deal about how much they saved you but you need a calculator to figure out how much you still owe the doctor or lab.  The old paper EOBs showed it better.  Also having issues with it needing to think about pulling up claims. It has hung on me three times so far.  Here is hoping that version 1.6 is better.......

name: myCigna
title: New feature, please!
text: I do love this app as it allows me to easily keep up with claims and charges. However, it would be beneficial if there was a tab for the pre-certification process, so users could easily go into the app and find out where they are in the pre-certification process, as well as find out if there is any missing information that is holding up their approval.

name: myCigna
title: Horrible app
text: I downloaded this app after the website was not working which shouldn't have shocked me that the app doesn't work either. Every time I try to log in it gives me the message to go to the web page or to exit the app. Also the web page doesn't work either. I cannot pull my ID cards, look at claims or find doctors/dentists because the tool bar is missing. We have this company through my husbands work. But I am very disappoint. This app and web site need to be fixed immediately if they want to keep their customers.

name: myCigna
title: Seriously?
text: Seriously? This much function at my fingertips for insurance, what a convenience!!!!!! It's about time! Just downloaded it and browsed through the app and so far I'm giving it 5 stars. Hopefully what I experienced in the few mins I viewed it, it holds up to the functionality of what it appears to be able to.

name: myCigna
title: canâ€™t log in, poor support service
text: concept is great and I was excited to get this but I was never able to log in. Always the same message telling me to call a support number, which I finally did today. After about and hour on the phone and bouncing to 4 different people I was told it was a known problem and the fix was to send a â€œticketâ€� to mobile app support.  Well that â€™s who the was supposed to answer the number I called in the first place. None seemed to know what was going on and worse no one seemed to care. This is crap.

name: myCigna
title: Great App
text: I only have long term disability through Cigna (thank god for that) but this app really helps tremendously. I can track when my monthly payment has been sent. And was able to see when they stopped paying me, and never told me. I like not having to call them to see when my money has been sent.

name: myCigna
title: Same experience as Kikie Horrible App
text:
Just like Kikie, the mycigna web site didn't work. The menu bar was solid blue and my only available options were to view what the site should do and to change my password. So I downloaded the app which is even more useless as I can't log in. All I get is a something went wrong message. It isn't a password problem as I tried a slightly different login password and got a message saying the user name and password combination were in error. The problem lies elsewhere.

Doesn't Cigna test any of their tools?

name: myCigna
title: Outstanding app
text: This app is great!! Eliminates controversy with the doctors office because all the info they need is in the app.  I will never have to worry about what is covered everything is there. BEST YET!!!! The only recommendation would be to tap the drug info from the cost side and tap into the drug contact info in the personal side Hope this makes since!  Great app

name: myCigna
title: Lots of room for improvement
text:
Need finger print login, like the banking APPS. Information need better organization. You can see you medical card, but just a few numbers not a nice graphical card that resembles the printed card you receive.

Every time one visits a medical  office they are asked for the medical card. Need to be able to supply this via the app.

I just started using the APP and it apparent there is a lot of room for improvement.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Worked well for me
text: I didn't have any problems with getting a list of doctors in my area or bringing up my claims or the copy of my insurance card...and my iPhone 4 can be pretty slow sometimes. ðŸ˜Š

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Does not work if you have Covered CA
text:
I haven't gotten this application to ever work. The website logs in just fine. When using this app with the same credentials, it just says login not found and boots you back to the front page. 

Seems like blue shield has a two tired system for those with ACA and people thorough private company coverage â€¦ totally worthless.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: I am scared to use this thing
text: After reading all the reviews, and suffering misery on the website, I am thinking, this must be worse. The website has improved, Iâ€™ll give BSCA that. But the guy who said they are stuck in the 90s was being a bit cruel. They are simply stuck in 2005. : (

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Canâ€™t cut and past password
text: I use 1 password app now for all passwords and your app does not allow me to cut and paste the password. Either change that or come up with another solution. Use touchID, allow to remember password (bad one) or integrate into 1password app extension. This is a big pain and I can not stand logging into your app.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Still no pasteâ€¦
text: We're still not able to paste our passwordsâ€¦

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Canâ€™t paste password
text: Hard to log in with strong passwords.

name: Blue Shield of California
title: Great
text: Like it

name: Blue Shield of California
title: They killed my original review!
text:
I used to have a laundry list of things I found wrong with this app. Every time an update came out, I simply reposted the same reviewâ€”no edits were necessary because none of my complaints were ever addressed (yes, I checked each time).

Well, they finally did something about itâ€”they deleted my entire review from the App Store! Classy. 

Here's the long and short of it: learn to love the blueshieldca.org website on your desktop browser, because the same website is far inferior in Mobile Safari, and this app is even more inferior than using the website in Mobile Safari.

name: MyHumana
title: Humana options
text: Humana employees their website that salute Lee terrible they sent the stuff that we didn't even order and we never got the stuff that we did order this is just horrible in there should be some kind of stand or sit there help to us is our second time we've tried them set a few things got better but most of it got worse forget the website although when you call them they'll tell you you need to use the website no way what a wait what a ripğŸ‘�

name: MyHumana
title: Mrs
text: I really love this app, it's very user friendly & saves me a lot of time since everything is right at my fingertips! ðŸ˜Š

name: MyHumana
title: Promising, but not there yet
text: Interface is clear and navigation in the app is well laid out. But … inability to paste password from a password manager is deal breaker for me. Plus many errors retrieving claims - maybe server performance problems?

name: MyHumana
title: Horrible
text: Crashes every time you try to look up a drug pricing. ğŸ‘�ğŸ‘�

name: MyHumana
title: Happy
text: Simplified experience. ğŸ˜€ğŸ˜€

name: MyHumana
title: Terrible!!!
text: I can't price my prescriptions anymore. App doesn't help me. ğŸ˜

name: MyHumana
title: Web site communications
text:
Not user friendly.
Would help that you expose all information, including the drug name on all communications .
Your password protection should include a reset feature, that is in the original communication, that allows the customer, to request a reset be sent to his email address so he can create a current pass word.
My sense is you are not understanding your customer base and should interview 8 or 10. 65+ year old customers.  
Think retail and what this 65+ year old customer receives at his local CVS or Walgreens .    Get competitive from a customer service perspective .
  Bet you will get more Biz.
To even send this message you require a nickname. I’ve tried 6so far and they are all taken.   This is perceived as a knot hole to inhibit feedback.   Not good
Rethink please

name: MyHumana
title: Access | Maybe or Maybe Not
text: The first time I downloaded the Humana App it allowed me access. No issues. Trying to log in today and it says “we cannot connect at this time, try again later”. Thank goodness I didn’t need anything at the moment for a doctors appointment. This is inconvenient. Same with Go365 in which I will write the same review for that app. And yes I know my username and password and yes I’m entering the correct username and password. It’s not always a user error. This app should be working.

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: What?
text: So I am a new Anthem card holder and literally just finished the registration process before writing this. I completed it on my iPhone in the safari web browser but it asked me to check out the app, which I usually prefer anyways. When I got to the App Store to download it I was worried it wouldn’t be worth it bc of all the 1 star reviews complaining about not being able to view the electronic copy of the ID card. So after deciding to check out the app for myself to see, I found out that there is absolutely no issue with the app and I pulled up the ID card in seconds. By simply selecting “Menu” -> “My Coverage” -> “ID Card” an image of the ID card will pop up with a front and back. I hope this helps bc I know how stressful it is to not have a copy of the card!

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: USELESS!!!!
text: UPDATE: THIS AP STILL ISN’T WORKING!!! This app used to work... somewhere after an update it stopped working and doesn't allow me to log on. Touch ID stopped working, and when I put in my log-in information I get a pop-up warning that I am not registered to use the mobile app. What?? I've used it in the past, and even have a postcard that says I am registered to use Anthem Anywhere. Called tech support and was told the app is "being refreshed" and to uninstall and reinstall the app. After more than several attempts doing just that, still no luck. Please fix this app so it works again!!

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: The potential is there
text:
I downloaded the app because, like many others, I liked having a digital copy of my ID card. Upon downloading and my first use, it was great!

Then it would not log me in—it would just spin and spin and spin. This is quite frustrating when you are at the dr w/o a physical card bc you were only sent one ID card and have five people covered in your insurance...

Now there are only two options on my home screen: find a dr and member profile. I can no longer access my ID card?! What’s the point?

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: Can’t pay premiums
text: I can’t pay my premiums through the app OR website from a mobile device, even from specialized browsers that let me request Anthem’s desktop site - it still forces the mobile site on me, which doesn’t allow for making payments like the desktop site. The “mobile app” is just the lousy, limited mobile site ported into an app icon. There’s no point and I have to call every month to make my payment instead of paying through the website, which I used to be able to do before the “mobile improvements.”

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: Unable to login
text: Keep getting “Something went wrong” message. Doesn’t happen on mobile safari or desktop browser. I called technical support, they reset password to test it themselves. Felt shady but let them do it anyway. The technical customer service was very bad, and bad background noise. He was also talking to someone loud and laughing, completely unprofessional! Anyway, they finally acknowledged the problem and said would open a ticket and contact me when resolved. It’s been a week and still wouldn’t work.

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: “Unable to Retrieve your Information”
text:
This app constantly loads for up to 5 minutes at a time and often is “Unable to find your information.” Sometimes it works sometimes it doesn’t. When it does though, it’s only a matter of time before you reach another error. 

This has happened several time when I have clicked on a doctor that I want to see, only to be unable to view the information due to an app error

The app fails to fulfill its most basic and only function.

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: Worthless
text: Just not even worth the data to download it. Zero functionality to look at your own information and claims. I would recommend removing from AppStore due to it having zero value. A picture of an ID card is better, takes up less memory and doesn’t track your activity and location. This is complete waste of everyone’s time and everyone should be given a dollar for the lack of effort Anthem and the developers did on this piece. This needs a negative star rating option.

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: Absolutely Terrible App
text: This app is awful. I mean awful. Besides it being a web app it’s out of date and just not optimized. The chat feature is full of bugs (sends duplicate messages, constantly exits out of the text box as you type, buttons overlap not allowing you to send, ect). I don’t even care it’s not iPhone X optimized but it just doesn’t work. Get your act together Anthem/BCBS. I’d cost you a few thousand dollars to fix this app. That’s peanuts to you. It would also greatly improve the quality of care we can get.

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: Pointless
text: If you are using this simply as a digital ID card then it serves its purpose. This app doesn’t allow you to do anything else you would want to do from the website. The iOS website version is identical and useless. If you want to check your claims, how much you owe on your deductible, or anything else you can’t do it from the app. You have to log onto a desk top or true lap top computer to access the real website, and any useful information that an app is supposed to simplify for you.

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: Customer service chat does not work on IPhone 7
text: Tap into the text entry field and start typing and as soon as the customer service rep types and a speech bubble appears for him/her, I lose focus on the text entry field and my input keyboard is dismissed. Clicking back into the text entry field does not bring the keyboard back up and once I click into the text field, I cannot click outside of it. Pathetic that an app for a major insurance carrier is this bad, and that’s coming from a ux design professional of 20+ years.

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: App won’t start
text:
I downloaded the app and gave it my credentials and it worked just fine. Until I was standing in a providers office with them wanting my I’d card. I don’t like a fat wallet so I don’t carry physical cards—I use smartphone apps whenever possible. So when the silly app wouldn’t start I had to run home to retrieve the physical card. I’ve tried deleting and then reinstalling the app. No good. Why have an app that won’t work. I would have thought you would be more prepared to do business than you are. 

-Dennis

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: Something Isn’t Working
text: I primarily downloaded this app so I could have a digital copy of my health insurance card, but it didn’t seem like that part of the app was working, giving me a “Something isn’t working” message. I went into my Messages to see if I could report this issue, but, “Something isn’t working” there, either. I’m not sure what else does work in this app, but the one thing I wanted it to do didn’t work.

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: App is completely not usable, for anything.
text: Had nothing but problems with this app. Numerous something isn’t working messages, emails unable to send, basically every function is non-functioning. I couldn’t even get the search for physician function to work properly. According to this app’s search results, there are ZERO in-network doctors, hospitals, and clinics in my metropolitan area of 200,000 people. I don’t see how this was even allowed to be released to the public. Nothing works.

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: “Our app isn’t working right now...”
text:
I received an email offering this new advancement in health service. I downloaded it and the very first message I received on screen was “Our app isn’t working right now.” 
Really? I’ve already been overly displeased with ABCBS - it was bad enough when they wouldn’t cover my husband’s ER visit last fall for which he wound up having SURGERY. This is just insulting....and loaded with ignorance. Get it together before you offer any other, ahem, “conveniences”.

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: No log in
text: I downloaded the app and tried to register. It kept telling me to call the number so I decided to try my computer instead. The website worked fine and let me register no probably. I figured I’d try the app again with a log in now and it won’t let me sign in now still telling me to call the number. Not helpful at all! The website isn’t much better but you can actually sign in on there.

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: Slow
text: This app is really slow. It take way longer than it should to load and to go from page to page within it. It’s a pain to use because I can’t just check it in a pinch. I have to make sure I have plenty of time to do what I need to because of how slow it is.

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: Terrible app
text: App has minimal features and those it has don’t work. I can’t view my ID card or anything else. The app needs to let us see our individual and family deductible and how much is net/remaining and also view recent claims. It should also let us see our benefits and EOB’s. The app is worthless. About all you can do is try to search for a doctor and that doesn’t even show you who all is available.

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: Didn’t have what I hoped
text: It’s a nice little app if you’re just looking for the basics. My main reason for downloading was to be able to see if procedures were covered and what copays were, etc. you won’t find anything of that nature in this app.

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: Limited info and buggy
text: None of my claims details show up even though they were more than 30 days ago. The message sender does not work at all: the “Subject” pull-down menu is empty but the message will not send because it errors out if you don’t pick a subject. Pretty disappointing app from a multimillion dollar corporation.

name: Anthem Anywhere
title: Completely useless
text: Downloaded app because the anthem web portal for customers is so buggy it doesn’t work 60% of the time. However with the app you can’t submit a claim, check in the status of a claim, or view any of your benefit info. The thing is slow useless supplement to the slow broken website.  Anthem seriously needs to get its tech on track - it’s an embarrassment.

name: Anthem Anywhere

I suspect there is some condition on user name or passwords that are not stated in the instructions.  Since this is my first interaction after switching insurance companies I am very unimpressed.

name: Anthem Anywhere

Every time I try to access the site from the web browser and request desktop site, it still forces me to the app. I will be deleting it since itâ€™s just taking up precious space on my phone.
